orders
Class OrderX

java.lang.Object
  orders.OrderX
All Implemented Interfaces:
middle.OrderProcessing
public class OrderX
extends java.lang.Object
implements middle.OrderProcessing

The order processing system.
Manages the progression of customer orders, instances of a Basket as they are progressed through the system. This is achieved by holding 3 seperate lists of orders, each list represents a specific stage in the orders life cycle. These stages are:
Waiting to be processed
Curently being picked
Waiting to be collected

Version:
2.0
Author:
Michael Alexander Smith

Method Detail

getOrderState

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> getOrderState()
                                                                                throws middle.OrderException
Returns information about all the orders (order number) in the order processing system This consists of a map with the orders in the 3 states: "waiting to be processed", "curently being picked" and "waiting to be collected". 
 Key "Waiting"       -> a list of orders waiting to be processed
 Key "BeingPicked"   -> a list of orders that are currently being picked
 Key "ToBeCollected" -> a list of orders that can now be collected

Specified by:
getOrderState in interface middle.OrderProcessing
Returns:
a Map with the keys: Waiting, BeingPicked, ToBeCollected
Throws:
middle.OrderException

getOrderToPick

public catalogue.Basket getOrderToPick()
                                throws middle.OrderException
Returns an order to pick from the warehouse. However if there is no order avilable then return null.
